Reviews.Content: Stay away We stayed here only for a day fortunately.I couldn't stand the stench in our rooms. Ventilation's not good.The fridge did not work and leaked. Toilet was dirty when we arrived. Beds were foul-smelling. Not a lot of channels on TV.Front desk not really helpful. But the concierge was.Not sure why we stayed there. There are better and cleaner hotels nearby like Hotel 81.Halal food nearby. Nearest MRT is 10-minute walk. Not much night life except the fruit stall hahahFor the amount we paid, not worth staying there.Sorry, no photos since the state of hotel is appalling.
Reviews.Author: cheekyjiva

Reviews.Content: Cheap and not-so-cheerful but not as terrible as it seems Whist the Lion City Hotel is not going to win any awards for decor or newness, being a rather tired looking hotel, I find the criticisms of it rather unfair. For starters, whilst it is a 5-10 minute car ride from Geylang, it is hardly located smack in the middle of the red-light district. It is conveniently located near a MRT station which made travelling into the city a very quick and painless experience.It IS very close to a night bazaar and hawker food centre - however these are typical of many suburban areas in Malaysia and Singapore and are not as seedy as some might think. It is possible to get a taste for simple, local cuisine nearby, which some people might welcome. I thought the food in the nearby area was far superior to that I experienced at the Newton Food Centre, by far the most well-known and most visited by tourists.The hotel is very tired looking as far as the rooms go and there were small irritances like the TV remote not working. The bathrooms were also in need of a revamp. On the plus side, there was a decent fridge and a new kettle. This is certainly not the place for a romantic getaway or a high-powered business executive. However, if you are desperate for a room (say around F1 weekend), I am sure there are far worse hotels in the Asia-Pacific region.
Reviews.Author: cobra_awsom

Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in! Was unfortunate enough to spend 2 nights in this scar of a Hotel. The staff were very rude and Un-courteous (which is something I found at most places in Singapore) The room simply reeked of cigarettes! The bathroom looked well worn but looked clean. I skipped the meager breakfast offered with the room on both mornings. It was far away from anything. A member of our group had inadvertently shifted one of the seats in the lobby while waiting for our ride, just as she reached the door to leave she was rudely asked to move the seat back the few inches to its original location. Send only your enemies to stay here, we got only an unqualified apology from our travel agent. and don't believe the decietfully designed hotel web site!
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo

Reviews.Content: Absolute pits in red light district I booked this hotel for my husband and I, and also my brother and his family to stay in for 3 nights. We needed somewhere reasonable that could cater my brother and his wife plus their 2 small children and 1 infant.We arrived at midnight. We didn't realise the hotel is in Geylang, a notorious red light district. The reception area is very smart but it ends there. We took the lift to our flloor and the corridor was minging to say least. No wallpaper, but writing on walls. Maybe being prepped for decorating. It also smelt fusty. My husband and I had superior room which was far from superior. It wasn't even clean, there were ring marks from drinks all over. The bed linen was okay but no other facilities available. Bathroom was mildewy and shower leaked so floor always wet. My brothers family had a room the same as ours with no beds for the 5 and 3 year old. After much complaining the reception staff brought 2 mattresses for the floor and they slept on those. Their room smelt of stale smoke despite my request for non smoking room.Fortunately I had printed off a copy of the reply from the hotel confirming my booking otherwise they would not have helped us at all. When I stood my ground and insisted on beds for the children the receptionist ran away.Avoid this pit at all costs.
Reviews.Author: ZedhedzZ

Reviews.Content: Reasonable Rates But Not Much Else This is quite an old hotel located not too far from the airport but a little further from the main shopping areas. This is not too much of a problem though as taxis are cheap and plentiful and the MRT close by together with clusters of small stores and markets. Although the hotel is supposed to have had a makeover a few years ago, it seems that it might be just about due for another, more extensive one. Hotels rooms are reasonably priced and spacious enough but the decore is dated and dowdy with the bathrooms in particular having seen better days. There鈥檚 no TV remotes in the lower priced rooms.Hotel facilities are basic but probably adequate for most, although the ground floor restaurant is bright and cheery and the food is quite good. The reception area is not too flash by Singapore standards and while the staff are efficient they come across as dour and unfriendly, almost to the point of being unwelcoming.If you just want basic overnight accommodation with few frills, away from the mainstream tourist traps, and can tolerate the all too frosty reception, then this hotel is reasonably good value.
Reviews.Author: sd1v8

Reviews.Content: Cheap and Convenient choice - Lion City Hotel That's a good choice if you don't want to spend too much on hotel ( but spend much $$ to shopping, eating ... haa...) . It's located near many shot at Singapore, only 1 to 2 station to go famous places. The facilities at hotel are complete with nothing missing. Around the hotal are something mini-food market.
Reviews.Author: Pakwan

Reviews.Content: Unacceptable Service Standard The hotel is very old, not only the decaration and even the room facilities esp the bathroom. Receiptionist is extremely unfriendly, no smiling and no chioce of the breakfast.The main problem is, there are so noise in the morning (7:00) traffic sounds and the speaking of the room keeper so loudly, which let you get up very early. Its so distrub to the trip. Also we lost a T-shirl in the 2nd day, when we told the receptionist, they just ask us call house keeping by myself. When we call that, they just said will search on next day. On next day until we asked the founding, they have no answer and unwilling to help us search. Even when we check out, they still no response to us.This is a unacceptable service standard. If you are no demands, only request a bed for sleep at night, it may be you choice, otherise make a deeply consideration to choose this hotel!!!!!
Reviews.Author: QK226

Reviews.Content: Definitely No Worthwhile Context----------------Booked 5 nights in march with AsiaBestHotel.com for 45EUR a night.Location----------------Good location even if the hotel is not located downtown.It is 5 min-walk from PayaLebar Station (EW8) and next to the Malay Village. Many places to eat around.No safety issue when walking at night.Travelling By MRT- to Changi Airport takes 15 mins- to City Hall station takes 10 minsRoom----------------Got room #504. It is a definitely a very bad room: old, used and noisy.Asked for non-smoking room and got a one smelling cigaret!The carpet is old and used; At the entrance of the bathroom the carpet is always wet with moulds.The bath-tub is leaking, flooding the floor and making it slipping.The TV didn't work well: could only watch a few local channels.No in-room safe but a safe is available at the lobby.No mini-bar but a empty refrigerator is avalaible: I filled it with drinks  snacks at the 7 Eleven next to the hotel.The room was quite noisy because next to the elevator.Furthermore a thick door only separated my room and the one next to mine; I could hear everything in the other room, very annoying...Breakfast----------------Very few choices of meals and tasteless. Instead, go to a food court nearby for a tasty and inexpensive local breakfast.Staff----------------The staff is unfriendly and almost rude.At check-in: no hello, no smile, they just gave me my room key.Using the safe at the lobby: the staff member said safe key; you loose it you pay it, han!. Oh my god, He spoke to me if I were a 12 year old child!At check-out: no good bye, no smile, they just get the key. It seems they do not worry about their guests... they have plenty buses of chinese tourits awaited.Summary----------------I was very happy to leave such a place after being stucked during 5 nights. I won't definitely come back to this hotel.I think there are much better budget hotels in Singapore.
Reviews.Author: huow

Reviews.Content: Value for money We have just returned from a week at the Lion City Hotel. The room is quite basic but clean. The reception staff were not too friendly, We don't see a smile on their faces. Breakfast was acceptable but the spread were the same thru' out our stay, on contrast, the service staff are great diffrent from the reception, they're always smiling and helpful. We paid about S$100 per night for a room with twin beds.Overall I would say this is probably a good budget hotel that I would recommend.
